instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LVDS_DDC_CLK: What is LVDS_DDC_CLK? LVDS_DDC_CLK Is the DDC clock line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.LVDS_DDC_DATA: What is LVDS_DDC_DATA? LVDS_DDC_DATA Is the DDC data line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_LCD: What is PP3V3_S5_LCD? PP3V3_S5_LCD is a power rail that eventually powers circuitry in the LCD after going through something else. This is required for the LCD to turn on and have a nimage. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage in lcd connector area. Connector replaced and jumper for backlight was put in place. Board turns on, chime and everything but no image or backlight. I replaced connector second time to make sure that I got it right.

Gpu has power,  
=<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_LCD</SIGNAL> - present 
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_CLK</SIGNAL> - present 
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_DATA</SIGNAL> - present

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 0 but it should be 3. 

It looks like board doesnt detect LCD, so I ordered new lcd and flex. Tested and  get the same result, no image or backlight. 
Is there way to check if lcd being recognized? perhaps I got defective screen/flex?

Or what other signals do I need to check for image? all lines on the connector are present, no short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message: External video present? GPU getting power at L8930?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10476"]External video present? GPU getting power at L8930?[/QUOTE]

Yes I have power for at L8930 - 0.9v i assume it is close enough to 1v
I don't get any external video (thunder to hdmi adapter)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
I suspect <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> shorted after lvds damaged.
Did you check <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>? Voltage at Pin 1,3,5? Pin 5 to ground is shorted? Check at first 10s. Later enable signal will disappear probably.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message: No if <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is dead then the backlight will still work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10498"]<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?[/QUOTE]

Duke thanks for suggestion, but I have checked LID before, it is high, 3v3

<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> doesnt have short, however one thing is strange. Pin 3 has low resistance to ground 0.565k, 0.122 diod mode. I still get 3v3 volts there, while screen pluged in.

I dont have other <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> motheboard but I compare to other two 15" boards and readings are complitly different, normal ~0.500 in diod mode. THis readings are with or without <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>, so it comes from power rail, any suggestions if thats the clue or it is normal?
Is possible that 3v3 is present but current is low so it doesn't power the chip?
I have replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message: Connect a HDD with a good OSX that fully boots. Then connect an external screen. The GPU driver needs to be loaded for HDMI to work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
Well since you asked to come back and check for external signal, I decided to make sure that my adapter works with working machine, and it doesn't. I reordered on, should arrive on monday. 

Is there something I can do without adapter? what is the conclusion if I get external image? defective lcd, or flex?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message: Wait for a working adapter. IF there is external image we at least know the GPU is working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime, no image
threads.message:
I got adapter, there is no external image.

I put in bootable harddrive, macbook chimes, I waited for awhile, no image. So you think it is gpu?

I am not confident with this conclusion, because some laptop require LCD detect for external monitor to work. (non apple)
